rounds.summary: 1 Critical (JSON comment invalid), 3 Major (delivery copy inconsistency, CI-only test policy violation, overstated linting protection), 1 Minor (unknown skill). All addressed in revision.

findings.message: The documented default copy ('Ships in 2-5 business days' without qualifier) contradicts the same doc's safer EU-qualified position. Addressed: default copy updated to EU-qualified throughout.

generatedAt free-text recommendation weakens provenance semantics. Addressed: replaced with _manualExtension key approach; generatedAt kept date-formatted; sourceHash provenance drift called out as accepted temporary exception.
Provenance drift (sourceHash) not explicitly noted as temporary exception. Addressed: explicit call-out added.

rounds.summary: Round 2: 8/10 (lp_score 4.0, credible). No Critical. 2 Major addressed in post-round revision. Round 3 not required (no Critical remaining).

findings.message: Payment processor named as Stripe throughout plan; actual processor is Axerve (confirmed via checkout-session route.ts). Addressed: all Stripe references replaced with Axerve/Secure-checkout-only constraint.

TASK-01 edge case specifies returning hardcoded fallback strings when trustStrip absent â€” contradicts all-copy-from-content-packet constraint. Addressed: return type changed to undefined; callers render nothing when undefined.
sourceHash desync from direct JSON edit acknowledged but mitigation insufficient. Addressed: _manualExtension key and materializer re-run risk documented explicitly.
Rollback file count inaccurate ('revert four files' vs 7). Addressed: all 7 files enumerated in Summary.
IO mock note says 'consistent with existing patterns' but planning validation confirms no IO mock exists. Addressed: note updated to say IO mock must be written from scratch.

rounds.summary: Round 1: 7/10 (lp_score 3.5). No Critical. 3 Major addressed. All findings resolved in post-round revision.

findings.message: Materializer re-run will silently remove trustStrip from JSON; mitigation underdocumented. Addressed: explicit risk note added stating materializer rewrites full payload and does not model trustStrip; _manualExtension as guard documented.
TC-01 hardcodes exact unconfirmed delivery string expectation. Addressed: TC-01 updated to assert structural properties (non-empty, contains 'business days') not exact phrase.

IO mock evidence contradiction ('confirmed' from ProductGallery vs. line 396 says no IO mock). Addressed: line 361 rewritten to state no existing IO mock; standard ecosystem pattern written from scratch.
it.todo() placeholders could be committed without full implementation. Addressed: execution plan note added that todo stubs must not be committed; first repo commit must contain passing tests.

rounds.summary: Round 2: 7/10 (lp_score 3.5). No Critical. 3 Major addressed. All findings resolved in post-round revision.

findings.message: TASK-04 confidence 85% in Task Summary table but 80% in task detail and overall-confidence math. Addressed: Task Summary table updated to 80%.

DAG under-constrained: TASK-03 and TASK-04 both modify page.tsx with only manual coordination notes. Addressed: TASK-04 Depends-on updated to include TASK-03; Parallelism Guide Wave 2 updated so TASK-04 is in Wave 3 with atomic commit requirement.

IO mock too minimal for TS strict mode (missing unobserve, takeRecords, cast). Addressed: green-phase mock updated with full IntersectionObserver interface fields and 'as unknown as typeof IntersectionObserver' cast.
Intermediate 75% score still visible with 'build-eligible' label before rescoring to 80%. Addressed: scoring section collapsed to show final 80% only; intermediate text removed.

rounds.summary: Round 3 (max): 7/10 (lp_score 3.5). No Critical. 3 Major addressed in post-round revision. Round 3 is the maximum; no Critical findings remain. Plan proceeds to build.
